newsitem.title: AUSTRALIA: RTRS-Australia's AMP quiet on ScotAm report.
newsitem.headline: RTRS-Australia's AMP quiet on ScotAm report.

text.p: The Australian Mutual Provident Society (AMP) said on Wednesday it could not comment on reports it was among the favourites to buy U.K. life insurance mutual Scottish Amicable, but added it was looking at acquisitions.
"We are not confirming or denying that at this stage," an AMP spokesman told Reuters.
A U.K. life insurance expert at ratings agency Standard & Poor's told Reuters that AMP and Dutch insurer Aegon were the favourites to buy the U.K. insurer.

"What we are saying is that we have never made it any secret that we are looking for acquisitions in the U.K., Europe the United States as well as parts of Asia," the spokesman said. The spokesman said AMP had made it clear when it announced its demutualisation process in December that it would look at acquisitions over the next 18 months.
Scottish Amicable is also in the process of demutualisation and plans to release these details and flotation plans at the beginning of next week.
Speculation over the future of Scottish Amicable came after last week's 1.4 billion stg bid for the insurer by Abbey National AN.L, Britain's fifth largest bank.
